fields.description: I am on the "uncommited changes" commit in Log View, and I select multiple removed lines and copy, then paste in Visual Studio. The paste works as expected (I get the selected lines without "-"), but then Source Tree crashes.
fields.summary: Copying and Pasting Removed Lines from Working Copy Changes in Log View Causes Exception

fields.description:
When there is a pending commit that has not yet been pushed, it should show that next to the branch name. The OSX version does this; in http://www.sourcetreeapp.com/img/screenshots/st_feature_diff.png, for example, you can see 1 up and 5 down for master. This doesn't seem to be happening here.

To reproduce:
1. Make a commit to a branch but don't immediately push it up
fields.summary: Show pending pull/push requests in sidebar

fields.description:
It would be great if the source tree client could also connect to a JIRA server so that when editing a commit message, you could search for and enter JIRA issue numbers into the text of the commit message.  For example when you type a project key followed by a dash, like ABCD-, you would get a drop down of the open issues in ABCD.  
This would make it easier for developers to annotate their commits with the related JIRA issues.  Without issues like mistyping the issue number or transposing digits that come from having to copy the number from a browser window, or memory.  Plus there are fewer clicks in the workflow.
fields.summary: Jira issue picker in commit editor

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to select a shell for the terminal button besides just bash or cmd.  For example being able to use powershell here would be nice.
fields.summary: Allow customization of git shell

fields.description: After a successful installation, clicking the option to download and configure embedded Git crashes the application.
fields.summary: Application crash when trying to download embedded Git after installation

fields.description: Adding Git Flow for the Windows version of SourceTree would be a great addition.
fields.summary: Git Flow

fields.description: As requested via Twitter: https://twitter.com/arunasmazeika/status/308894557536391168
fields.summary: Support creating patches from uncommitted changes

fields.description:
if you made an fi-merge (from master to feature-branch) and that commit shows also all files changed in the feature-branch without any changes.

git diff HEAD HEAD~1 does not show all those files, only those merged from master

please fix that, there is no chance to find out what has changed...
fields.summary: FI - Merge - contains all files modified on target branch without changes

fields.description:
I can't open any of my pre existing hg repositories in Source Tree. Either view drag and drop or by the File -> Open.. menu

I get the error:

The path '<path name here>' is not a valid Git or Mercurial repository working copy.

I can view the repository fine in tortoiseHg or via the hg command line.
fields.summary: can't open existing hg repository

fields.description: When a file is marked as conflict in the working copy, the lines showed in the diff panel always start from 0
fields.summary: Line numbers in conflict pane is reset

fields.description: everywhere you can check items
fields.summary: change checked-state of selected items with space bar

fields.description: Git will sometimes format its output in a way that assumes a monospace font, making it look ugly in SourceTree for Windows where a proportional font is used. I will attach a screenshot illustrating the issue. Switching to a monospace font in the associated text area should solve this.
fields.summary: "Show Full Output" area should use monospace font

fields.description: When pushing to heroku, the deploy logs are returned and it would be nice if the output textview would work like a -tail command and scroll down to show the latest content
fields.summary: Commit dialog's output textview should scroll down to show the latest output

fields.description:
Merged Branch with conflicts.
I tried to resolve the conflict with the external Diff Viewer (TortoiseMerge)
Then I closed the merge tool without saving.

Now the original conflicted file is gone and i have a new *.orig file.

I have to reset all and merge again, to get the conflicted file back!
fields.summary: Merge Conflict removes file and leaves *.orig file

fields.description:
When I have some files in my Staged Changes and some normal changes I clicked Commit.
The PopUp showed up with two seperate boxes (for staged changes and working copy changes)

then I selected "Commit Mode: Selected Files"
now only one Box appears, with the files of "working copy changes"

When I check these files and commit, boah!, also the files from "staged changes" have been commited!
fields.summary: Commit - Selected Files includes files in stash not checked

fields.description:
Requested via Twitter: https://twitter.com/LuaStoned/status/306716937386332161 

Seems sensible as this has been asked for / stated a few times.
fields.summary: Make it clear that Mercurial support is coming + only Git for now

fields.description: Commit command is present in contextual menu of working copy files but not in staged files. The option is already present in Mac version.
fields.summary: Missing commit option in contextual menu of staged files

fields.description: I was able to merge one file successfully, but the second file did not merge. I had DiffMerge configured so I changed over to KDiff3 instead and got the same crash.
fields.summary: Attempting to Merge File Caused Crash

fields.description: When I go to "View > Show Hosted Repositories" and click "Show Hosted Repositories" nothing happens. I have tested this on a co-workers Mac and he is presented with a dialog to hook up his bitbucket account.
fields.summary: "Show Hosted Repositories" won't open dialog

fields.description: http://screencast.com/t/hn7qJkP9Zowj
fields.summary: Delete button shows Confirm dialog when clicked, even without selection

fields.description:
I use a Wacom pen tablet instead of a mouse. Within about 20 seconds of launching SourceTree (or may be immediate), Windows turns on the built-in pen support, which I normally have disabled. This feature partially overrides the Wacom driver.

The visible effect is that a large (1/4 inch) circle appears around the mouse pointer with every stylus touch. The functional effect is that the pen's right-click side button no longer works, and as a result I am not able to use my computer normally.

Quitting SourceTree immediately returns the system back to normal. The only other application I have seen do this is MS Paint.

Expected behavior is that SourceTree would not make any changes to the current tablet state.
fields.summary: SourceTree application modifies Windows pen mode

fields.description: In the internal diff viewer of a javascript file there are missing ending braces as I highlighted on the screenshot.
fields.summary: Missing braces in the internal diff viewer

fields.description:
After installing and choosing to use the installed system Git, SourceTree did not automatically find my Git installation, despite it being on the path and in the default msysgit location (C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\bin\git.exe).

"where git" does report "C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\cmd\git.cmd" instead of the exe, however.

This is of course low priority, as I was able to browse to my Git installation just fine.
fields.summary: Doesn't find system Git, even in default location and in PATH.

fields.description:
When trying to edit the git config or .gitignore files through the settings button on the far right under the menu bar (settings -> Remotes tab -> Edit Config File or settings -> Advanced tab -> Edit (Repository-specific ignore list)), the files are not opened in a text editor. For the git config file, since it has no file extension, windows will prompt for a program to use every time you try and open it.

I'd like to be able to specify a text editor for opening all such files.
fields.summary: Default editor for config files

fields.description:
SourceTree crased when I tried to delete a tag from local AND remote repositories ("Remove tag from all remotes" checkbox). Remote is on bitbucket, only one branch exist (master).
The tag itself was removed, as I can see now.
fields.summary: Crashes on tag deletion

fields.description:
-1 installer try downloads 
-2 firewall user software popup "interactive rule windows"
-3 user grants access
-4 installer is stuck

When installer output network access is denied at installer download start, the installer "downloads" forever without any progress, even after the firewall correct rule is created.

Possible paths to fix the bug:
- A "restart/retry download" button.
- A Firewall detection like with quick ping for network connection would give users clue about the problem.
fields.summary: Installation & Firewall detection

fields.description:
german letters like 'ä' 'ö' 'ü' are not shown correctly

fix unicode encoding
fields.summary: encoding problem in git messages

fields.description:
I cannot use ć ó ł letters from the Polish Programmer keyboard in a commit message text field. 
Bug shows on Windows 7, SourceTree 0.8.2.0
fields.summary: cannot use some polish letters [extended character set support]
Crash after pull

fields.description: There isn't a mouse right-click menu available in the diff window. It'd be useful to be at least able to right-click and copy selected area, not to mention [committing a selected hunk|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-186].
fields.summary: Right-click menu in diff window

fields.description:
As described in the subject. I tried to copy a selected line from a diff hunk and the app crashed.

It might be related to the my other [copy to clipboard bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-187].
fields.summary: Crash when copying a selected line from diff hunk

fields.description:
Not even sure this is supported by the Mac version but I think it'd be great if SourceTree would allow marking/unmarking files as --assume-unchanged and listing them.

I use aliases for command line to do this as I need it on regular basis:

{code:title=~/.gitconfig|borderStyle=solid}
[alias]
    ignore-on-commit = update-index --assume-unchanged
    stop-ignore-on-commit = update-index --no-assume-unchanged
    show-ignore-on-commit = !git ls-files -v | grep "^[[:lower:]]"
{code}
fields.summary: Support for update-index --assume-unchanged (and the opposite)

fields.description:
Just wanted to copy Commit's SHA to clipboard (from commit log tree) and it crashed the moment I switched window focus to one I wanted to paste it to.

It doesn't seem to happen every time though.
fields.summary: Crash when copying commit SHA

fields.description:
At the moment it is possible to discard selected hunks (via button in diff window).
It'd be very useful to be able to stage or directly commit (if you don't use staging area) individual hunks as well.
fields.summary: Commit/stage individual hunks
Add support of combining selected commits to one
Add support of cherry-picking

fields.description: Appears that I can install labview merge and diff but can't associate different external exe's to be used with various file extensions, like .vi for labview files.
fields.summary: Diff/Merge

fields.description: Can't identify the version. Had to find the location of the .exe file using task manager. The setup.exe file conflicts with others in my download folder.
fields.summary: No shortcut after install(setup)

fields.description:
SourceTree uses folder browse dialog to select existing repository (File, Open). This prevents user from selecting network folder that is not mapped to a drive.

Choice of browse folder dialog also inhibits copy/paste of folder name.

One of solutions would be using standard dialog for folder selection on Windows Vista and above. This would be IFileDialog (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb775966(v=vs.85).aspx) with FOS_PICKFOLDERS flag. There is .NET example at http://www.jmedved.com/2011/12/openfolderdialog/.
fields.summary: Cannot open network folders

fields.description: Saw that 0.8.2 was available on the download page, so I opened my installation (0.8.0) and navigated to Help -> check for updates.  It crashed with the "Oh, my, this is embarassing app..."  and that's all I know.
fields.summary: SourceTree 0.8.0 crashed when checking for updates

fields.description:
First click on "Reverse hunk" is working - revert changes. But button is still enabled and can be pressed again.

Error message is displayed after second click:


---------------------------
Error encountered
---------------------------
'git apply' failed with code 1: Checking patch Syntaxes/Delphi.JSON-tmLanguage...
error: while searching for:

...
...diff code...
...

error: patch failed: Syntaxes/Delphi.JSON-tmLanguage:1
Applying patch Syntaxes/Delphi.JSON-tmLanguage with 1 reject...
Rejected hunk #1.
fields.summary: Display confirmation after reversing changes from a file/hunk/lines

fields.description:
If you add new repo bookmark using mouse (right-click > new) the prompt recognises where it was clicked and automatically sets the Bookmark Folder. 

This also happens when adding new repo from Bookmarks Sidebar's Bottom button, but the toolbar button doesn't seem to recognise it and always defaults to [Root].
fields.summary: Toolbar Clone/New button doesn't recognise selected bookmarks Folder

fields.description:
It'd be useful for tabs to be moved around.
At the moment there seems to be no way to reorder them other than close and reopen in desired order.
fields.summary: Tabs reordering

fields.description:
While SourceTree only requires a modest version of git (1.6+) which is some years old, it appears that some people still have older versions on their drive which SourceTree will pick up and use on install, which can occasionally cause problems (see linked). The embedded git is version 1.8.0 right now.

Detect the version of system git and treat it much like a missing system git if it's too old. We will need to make it clear that's why we're rejecting it so that people don't just browse to it and wonder why we still don't use it.
fields.summary: Detect old versions of git and suggest upgrade or switch to embedded

fields.description: After select many files with Shift or Control is not possible unselect files using the same keys (Shif/Control), is needed click in an unselect file and redo the selection again
fields.summary: Can't unselect a file clicking over it

fields.description:
Add recent repositories to windows 7 jump list like pageant

http://windows.microsoft.com/is-is/windows7/using-jump-lists-to-open-programs-and-items
fields.summary: Add jump list support

fields.description: Since it's for Windows and Windows has a powerfull shell, why not use it ?!
fields.summary: Propose PowerShell (possibly with posh-git) as terminal

fields.description:
When a remote is marked as "Default remote" in "Remote details" dialog is automatically renamed to "origin"

If there is another remote with the same name this remote will be removed without any additional advise.

The expected behavior is don't allow add two remotes with the same name in the "Repository Settings" dialog ("Remotes" tab) without rename one of them first.
fields.summary: Duplicate remote names / Mark a remote as default removes old default remote

fields.description:
When we launch the full public version, we should be sure to link directly to the setup.exe and not use the ClickOnce generated installer page (or even a customised version of that), because that doesn't work on Firefox (SRCTREEWIN-162), and we really want a one-step download.

Also consider renaming the setup.exe to SourceTreeSetup.exe so it's easier to identify (SRCTREE-133). Don't include the version number though as that will require extra queries/redirects, and actually won't work anyway since the real version number link is in the .application file it refers to, and you can't mess with that stuff without breaking the links used for auto-update etc.
fields.summary: Link direct to setup.exe for public release, maybe rename?

fields.description: The repository resides in X:\web from my perspective.
fields.summary: Crash during repo open on samba share

fields.description: Non Latin character in internal diff is broken. When you call external diff it's codepage set to Western European instead of default code page.
fields.summary: Add support for extended ANSI code pages in addition to UTF-8

fields.description:
Wanted to merge a feature branch to my develop branch (by right-click on feature branch > merge...) and got this error.
It seems that the merge completed just fine.
This isn't a regular issue, it happens only once so far.

!screenshot.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Error message when merging branches

fields.description: When you click on SourceTree license agreement on Welcome dialogue, you see empty document.
fields.summary: EULA doesn't display properly with Office installed

fields.description:
I moved a repository and wanted to update the path of the bookmark.
Source tree didn't seem to recognise automatically that the repo has been moved so I started looking around where I could update it manually.

I went into Repository Settings > Advanced Tab and wasn't really reading properly and hit the EDIT button for the "Repository-specific ignore list" and it crashed the app.

The app recognised that the repo has been moved on relaunch and offered to change the path then and that worked fine.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to edit ignore list of a moved repository

fields.description: I have an existing Mercurial local repository in my hard drive and I wanted to add it into SourceTree, but I get the message "This is not a valid working path". I followed the same procedure with a Git repository with no issues.
fields.summary: Unable to "Add Working Copy" from an existing Mercurial repository in my hard drive

fields.description:
Before crash ST show me this alert https://monosnap.com/image/ImStnW77Kf7FB6Ac3XemIPgZt

{noformat}
'git status' failed with code 129: error: unknown option `ignore-submodules=dirty'
usage: git status [options] [--] <filepattern>...
    -v, --verbose         be verbose
    -s, --short           show status concisely
    -b, --branch          show branch information
    --porcelain           show porcelain output format
    -z, --null            terminate entries with NUL
    -u, --untracked-files[=<mode>]
                          show untracked files, optional modes: all, normal, no. (Default: all)
    --ignored             show ignored files
{noformat}
fields.summary: Crash on open git repository (old git version)

fields.description: I use the portable version of MsysGit stuck in a bin/ directory so SourceTree couldn't find it. I chose the browse link and get an open-file dialog. Git.exe should be an entry in the file name drop-down or SourceTree should use the FOS_PICKFOLDERS variant so once you've picked the directory, you're done and don't have to go scrolling to find git.exe.
fields.summary: "Please specify location of git.exe" should be a folder-browse dialog or should have "git.exe" as the default filename

fields.description:
The publish page "launch" link just opens the app manifest in the same window. There isn't a ClickOnce plugin (enabled or disabled) in my instance of Firefox. 

Using setup.exe works fine to install the app.

Please consider using a real installer. I'm partial to building them with [WiX|http://www.wixtoolset.org/] but I'm biased. :)
fields.summary: Firefox 19.0 doesn't execute ClickOnce manifest, just displays it

fields.description:
The first line of the commit message should be 50 characters or less.  The rest of the message goes on the second line but wrapped at 72 characters.

For reference: http://git-scm.com/book/ch5-2.html

Example:
Short (50 chars or less) summary of changes

More detailed explanatory text, if necessary.  Wrap it to about 72
characters or so.  In some contexts, the first line is treated as the
subject of an email and the rest of the text as the body.  The blank
line separating the summary from the body is critical (unless you omit
the body entirely); tools like rebase can get confused if you run the
two together.

Further paragraphs come after blank lines.

 - Bullet points are okay, too

 - Typically a hyphen or asterisk is used for the bullet, preceded by a
   single space, with blank lines in between, but conventions vary here
fields.summary: Commit message formatting

fields.description:
It'd be very useful if there was an option to choose small toolbar icons. I find them way too big.

An option to disable icon labels would be very useful as well.
fields.summary: Small toolbar icons and no labels option

fields.description: The menu icons at the top of the application are jagged.  See attachment.
fields.summary: Menu Icons are Jagged

fields.description: The graph lines for branches and merges are cut off at the bottom.  See Attachment.  The issue is increased the greater the number of branches the line has to cross.  Shifting the origin point a few pixels up should solve the problem.
fields.summary: Lines on Graph Cut Off at bottom

fields.description: It would be nice to have git flow integrated how the OSX build has it.
fields.summary: Integrate git flow exactly like OSX build

fields.description: in the list of the jump-to feature of git log view are all branches,tags,... listed several times
fields.summary: git log - Jump to-feature - duplicate entries

fields.description:
If you add a new remote to a windows share like: \\zz-nas01\dev\codeRepo\Git\etc
sourcetree will save it as \zz-nas01\dev\codeRepo\Git\etc
First \ is missing.
So to get it to work right now it's \\\\zz-nas01\dev\codeRepo\Git\etc

I think \\ should be converted to \\\\ automatic?
fields.summary: Minor bug in add remotes

fields.description:
This only happened once.
I've used push to this url several times before.

-Added 3 files to index
-pressed commit button, them Push
-Crashed after some seconds but the push was completed, which I could check after restarting SourceTree
fields.summary: Crash during a Commit+Push operation

fields.description: I've had to load the .ssh private key file from disk every time Pageant has been restarted which is quite inconvenient. Also Pageant should be loaded automatically when SSH is used rather than waiting for an authentication failure.
fields.summary: Remember last SSH key picked when launching Pageant from SourceTree

fields.description: "discard selected lies" -> "discard selected lines"
fields.summary: Internal Diff - "discard selected lies"

fields.description: In my organisation we are not allowed to use Pull because of the potential automerge problems. It would be great if Fetch & Rebase could be made a single click like Pull (like it is in Tortoise Git Sync).
fields.summary: Make Fetch & Rebase as easy as Pull

fields.description:
When trying to push to a private repo on github, I entered the wrong password. So the authentication failed.  I couldn't see any way to update the bad password.

Work around: 
I worked around it by trying to add another private repo using the https://username@... syntax which triggered a username/password dialog box.  

If there isn't a more straight-forward way of updating the password (which I could have missed), then maybe there should be :)
fields.summary: No way to re-enter password

fields.description:
Customer comment:
bq. I really like that you have tabs for the different repos that are open, but I find the animation very annoying.
fields.summary: SourceTree Windows Feedback - Tabs

fields.description:
When I try to clone my bitbucket repository it complains for both URLs that "This is not a valid source path/URL":

https://nathasjornament@bitbucket.org/nathasjornament/stash-badgr
ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/nathasjornament/stash-badgr

fields.description:
1) Open Repository.
2) Select a commit.
3) Click on Reverse Selected Lines then Reverse Hunk (or some combination of clicking those buttons multiple times).
4) Application crashes.

I'm not sure if the file you are performing the actions on needs to have been added on that commit to replicate the crash.

The sourcetree.log seems to indicate that one of the steps in the process removed the file but then did not notify the UI, as there was no indication that clicking the button did anything (until the crash).
fields.summary: Application crash when clicking Reverse Hunk and Reverse Selected Lines

fields.description: Add a repository to bookmarks that has a file requiring extra permissions (Attached SQL Database file)
fields.summary: Crash with unauthorized access to file

fields.description:
While launching the main SourceTree window for the first time, it was annoying that it launched behind the start menu/task bar.

This happens because my task bar is in the upper edge (when normally Win 7 defaults to the lower edge).
ST's window spawns very high, therefore making it hard to close or move it. This is a trivial issue because it can be workarounded by using the Win Key + Arrows, or moving the task bar temporarily. Nontheless it's annoying.

Btw. the "Request a new feature" & "Raise a ticket" don't send me to this Jira tracker, but rather Attlassian's general one. It only found this tracker thanks to a link that came with the email from the beta.
fields.summary: Window is being placed behind the task bar.

fields.description:
Upon first start of the application, I grabbed five git repo folders and dragged four of them into SourceTree. I wanted to reorganize the four of them into a folder called "Dev", so I created the folder.

At that point, I dragged each repo into the Dev folder.  At this point, the repo disappeared from the screen and did not appear in the Dev folder either.

To verify, I readded the repos to the top level folder and then moved them to the Dev folder.  Same result - the repos were missing from the display.

I restarted SourceTree and the folders now appear twice in the Dev folder.

The attached screenshot shows the state of the application after I restarted.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop to folder results in repo being removed from SourceTree view until I performed a restart of ST
Crash

fields.description: I installed SourceTree and got a Git not found window. Well that's cause I use Hg not Git. Do I just point to the Hg?
fields.summary: Git not found on system; Using Hg
Close process dialog if completed and user unchecks Show Full Output

fields.description:
There's an annoying behavioural niggle which seems to be caused by Microsoft's DataGrid, which is used for the file lists in order to provide checkboxes in certain contexts. The issue is that when the default selection is in effect, which means the first file on the list, and you want to Shift-Click another file to select a range of files including that one, what actually happens is that the first click single-selects the file you select, and you have to Shift-Click a second time to get the range selection.

So far my attempts to override this behaviour have failed. I will need to fight MS's code some more on this I think.
fields.summary: Can't shift-click a range of files using default selection, have to click twice

fields.description:
If you hide bookmarks (Ctrl-B) then unhide them again, there is a noticeable delay before the bookmarks appear and it can be hard to know what's happening.

Since this is only adjusting view components, my belief is that this is the WPF layout engine that's stalling or taking a long time to sort itself out. Although it's not a particularly complicated view it does seem like initialising it is expensive, and we should investigate whether there are ways to speed this up, or failing that perhaps we can at least make it not hang. That could be tricky though since like most UI frameworks WPF has limitations on what threads can create / manipulate UI controls.
fields.summary: Unhiding bookmarks takes a long time

fields.description:
Damien reported this crash when switching branches:

{noformat}
Fatal error: 
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection.
Parameter name: index

Stack trace: 
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.get_Item(Int32 index)
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.LogViewModel.GetLogRetrievalFunc(Int32 skip)
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.LogViewModel.<LoadNextLogBatchFrom>d__1b.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.AsyncMethodBuilderCore.<ThrowAsync>b__0(Object state)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
{noformat}

Looking at the code, it appears that in GetLogRetrievalFunc the skip value was > 0, but the size of the LogRows list didn't allow retrieval. I can protect against that in future, but it suggests a problem earlier on that I don't fully understand. 

I've asked Damien if this is repeatable and if so to provide me with the repo so I can reproduce to investigate further.
fields.summary: Crash when switching branches
git-svn support
Full submodule support
